text: Carl Long (May 9, 1935 - January 12, 2015) was an American baseball outfielder. He was a Negro league and minor league baseball player. He played from 1952 until 1957 for teams such as: the Birmingham Black Baron, the Philadelphia Stars, St. Jean Canadians, Billings Mustangs, Phoenix Stars, Kinston Eagles, Beaumont Pirates, and Mexico City Tigers. Long was born in Rock Hill, South Carolina. He grew up in Kinston, North Carolina. Long died on January 12, 2015 after having many strokes in November 2014. He was 79. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1935 births Category:2015 deaths Category:African-American baseball players Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Sportspeople from North Carolina Category:Sportspeople from South Carolina
title: Carl Long (baseball)
